sources.description: Friendless travels west to try to make his fortune. Once there, he tries his hand at bronco-busting, cattle wrangling and dairy farming, eventually forming a bond with a cow named "Brown Eyes."Â

sources.title: Go West (1925) | Buster Keaton Silent Comedy Western | Colorized Public Domain Classic
sources.description:
Go West (1925) is a silent comedy directed by and starring the legendary Buster Keaton. Produced and distributed by Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, this film represents one of Keatonâ€™s most creative experiments, blending his trademark deadpan comedy with Western themes and frontier imagery. Known for his physical stunts, precision timing, and unshakable expression, Keaton uses Go West to parody both the American West and the culture of rugged individualism.

This restored and colorized public domain edition brings the dusty cattle ranches, open plains, and iconic Keaton gags into vivid detail. It is designed for modern audiences, especially older viewers in the United States and Europe, who can appreciate the artistry of Keaton while enjoying the film in a visually engaging format on TV and streaming platforms.

Plot Summary:
The story follows a lonely drifter known only as Friendless (Buster Keaton), who leaves his small-town life behind and heads west in search of opportunity. Lacking cowboy skills, charm, or toughness, Friendless finds himself out of place on a cattle ranch. Despite his struggles, he befriends a gentle cow named Brown Eyes, forming an unlikely bond.

As Friendless navigates the challenges of ranch life, his compassion for Brown Eyes sets him apart from the rough cowboys around him. When the ranchâ€™s herd must be transported through Los Angeles, Friendless ends up leading a cattle stampede through the city streets in one of the filmâ€™s most famous comedic sequences. Ultimately, Keaton transforms from a hapless outsider into an unlikely hero, proving that kindness can triumph over brute force.

Cast and Crew:
â€¢ Director: Buster Keaton
â€¢ Producer: Joseph M. Schenck
â€¢ Writers: Lex Neal, Byron Morgan
â€¢ Cinematography: Dev Jennings, Elgin Lessley
Starring:
â€¢ Buster Keaton as Friendless
â€¢ Howard Truesdale as the Ranch Owner
â€¢ Kathleen Myers as the Ranch Ownerâ€™s Daughter
â€¢ Brown Eyes the Cow (uncredited but central to the story)

Film Significance:
Go West is one of Buster Keatonâ€™s most original films, mixing slapstick comedy with tenderness and satire. Unlike his more famous works The General or Sherlock Jr., this film highlights Keatonâ€™s ability to create humor not just through stunts but through character relationships. His friendship with the cow Brown Eyes remains one of silent cinemaâ€™s most unusual and touching bonds.

The movie also represents Hollywoodâ€™s fascination with Westerns in the 1920s. By placing a clumsy outsider in this genre, Keaton lampooned Western hero stereotypes while exploring themes of loneliness, kindness, and survival.

Enhanced Public Domain Explanation:
This film is in the public domain, meaning it is completely free of copyright restrictions and can be legally shared, viewed, studied, and preserved without limitation. Colorized Public Domain restores and enhances these historic works through careful digital cleaning, visual restoration, and colorization techniques. Our mission is to ensure that timeless classics like Go West remain available to a worldwide audience. By presenting them in color and modern quality, we make them more engaging and accessible to younger generations while respecting the integrity of the original silent film.

Why Watch This Colorized Edition:
Originally released in black and white in 1925, Go West was visually striking but limited by the technology of its time. This colorized edition highlights the dusty landscapes, ranch settings, and urban chaos of the cattle stampede, making the action clearer for modern viewers. For audiences aged 55â€“64 in the United States and Europe, the restoration offers nostalgia with sharper detail. For newer generations, it serves as a vibrant entry point into the artistry of Buster Keaton.

metadata.Plot: A young man who doesn't find a job in his small hometown, tries his luck in New York, but is overwelmed by the life of the city, so decides to try his luck somewhere else after a only a few minutes in New York. He falls off a train near a ranch, where he tries his luck as a cowbowy, being in his own way very sucessful. But he shows what he can do when the farm has to bring a 100 head of cattle to the slaughterhouses of Los Angeles to avoid going bankrupt, against the will of his neighbour who wants a better price. After a shoot-out with the neighbour's men he's the only person on a Los Angeles bound train with 1000 cows....
metadata.Writer: Buster Keaton, Lex Neal, Raymond Cannon
metadata.Actors: Buster Keaton, Howard Truesdale, Kathleen Myers
